definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units

sentences.english: The bottom? Baghdad once again comes in at 215.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉克的巴格达无疑再次中标。

sentences.english: October 2007. A Skyline client wins a bid in a province.
sentences.chinese: 2007年10月，天际线的一家客户在某省中标。

sentences.english: Money will be escrowed immediately to winning bidder.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将提存立即中标人。

sentences.english: If the auction succeeds, the winners are expected to begin work in November.
sentences.chinese: 如果拍卖成功，中标者预计将在今年11月开始运行。

sentences.english: A Christie's spokeswoman would not reveal the identity of the winning bidder.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯蒂的女发言人不会透露中标者的身份。

sentences.english: Winning bidder must sign a non-disclosure, all source will be our property.
sentences.chinese: 中标人必须签订一份不泄密，所有源将是我们的财产。

sentences.english: It may also authorize the bid evaluation committee to decide on the bid winner directly.
sentences.chinese: 招标人也可以授权评标委员会直接确定中标人。

sentences.english: Mandatory parameters are marked with an asterisk in the first table column.
sentences.chinese: 必需参数在该表的第一列中标上了星号。

sentences.english: Successful bidders would be contacted with project documentation.
sentences.chinese: 中标者将接触的项目文档。

sentences.english: After get the bid of the project, we will prepare the pre-work as soon as possoble.
sentences.chinese: 项目中标之后，我们将立即开始前期准备工作。

sentences.english: The tenderer may also authorize the bid assessment committee to directly determine the winning bidder.
sentences.chinese: 招标人也可以授权评标委员会直接确定中标人。

sentences.english: The name list of members of the bid assessment committee shall be kept secret and confidential before the bidding result is made.
sentences.chinese: 评标委员会成员的名单在中标结果确定前应当保密。

sentences.english: Finally as soon as Bao Zhijie and Ding are selected, have this opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 最后包志杰和丁一中标，获得这一机会。

sentences.english: Reposting this project because the previous winning bidder failed to deliver it.
sentences.chinese: 重新发布这个项目，因为以前的中标人未能兑现它。

sentences.english: The identity of the winning bidder could not be immediately determined after bidding closed Friday night.
sentences.chinese: 周五晚上拍卖结束后胜出中标者的身份还未得到确认。

definition: standard gold bar/deposit when submitting a tender
to plan to/to draft (a plan)/to imitate/to assess/to compare/pseudo-
doubtful/suspicious/variant of 擬|拟[ni3]/to emulate/to imitate
to contract for an entire project
bid or tender submission or delivery/bid or tender document
to own a controlling number of shares in a company
